item.title: Report E-2024090245
item.description:
Report E-2024090245

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer, material handler discovered a drum that was slightly leaking from the bottom. Further investigation revealed that there was a small crack in the bottom of the drum that was slightly dripping. No action contributed to this failure other than it being a defective container. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the defective drum.

item.description:
Report X-2024090845

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS PORTLAND FACILITY WE RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS LEAKING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FOUR X ONE GALLON CANS OF FLAMMABLE CLASSIC EXPRESS STAIN WITH ONE CAN LEAKING. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM SOUTH CAROLINA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER J5H558, WHITE, 4115 DORCHESTER RD, NORTH CHARLESTON SC 29405-7466.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When unloading drum heard a bolt fall off open head drum while moving with fork truck. Lid popped off and about one cup of liquid came out. The drum lid was then replaced properly. the cause of the leak was because the shipper didn't tighten the bolt on the drum enough. The spill was contained and cleanup in house.

item.title: Report X-2024090738
item.description:
Report X-2024090738

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: CAMP HILL
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Cameron Logan Supervisor called safety to report a spill of UN1263, PAINT, 3, PG II. Cameron stated while the forklift operator was loading the pallet of paint, one of the 5-gallon pails on the pallet struck other fright in the trailer puncturing the bottom of one pail on the pallet the forklift was loading. Cameron stated the forklift operator turned the pail on to its top to stop the spill and removed the pallet from the trailer to the dock floor and reported the spill. Cameron stated it looked like the spilled on the trailer floor has dried up and can no longer see where it spilled, and the pallet has dried up as well showing no signs of a spill. Cameron stated it looks like 5oz may have spilled from the pail on the trailer floor and the pallet. Cameron stated he changed out the pallet with the spill with a new pallet for the other 3 pails and placed the damaged pail on the pallet wit h the spill. Cameron stated the spill on the trailer floor and on the pallet has dried and you can no longer see where the spill was and wanted to know what to do with the damaged pail. Safety advised CURA would be called to assist with the spill and the damaged pail.

  • Description: THREE PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED DUE TO A RECENT UNDECLARED DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE BEING FOUND FROM THE ACCOUNT HOLDER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE BOX CONTAINS FOUR X ONE GALLON CANS OF FLAMMABLE CLASSIC EXPRESS STAIN. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO OTHER CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1ZJ5H5581227456188 AND 1ZJ5H5581211001868. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS EACH CONTAIN SIX X ONE GALLON CANS OF FLAMMABLE CLASSIC EXPRESS STAIN. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM SOUTH CAROLINA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER J5H558, WHITE, 4115 DORCHESTER RD, NORTH CHARLESTON SC 29405-7466.

  • City: WILMINGTON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 3, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was crushed in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel discovered that one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 washer fluid and one (1) 5-gallon pail of non-regulated washer fluid were damaged and released approximately three (3) gallons of product. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the sulfuric acid-impacted impacted dock floor. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums

  • City: BOONVILLE

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 3, 2024, twelve (12) 1-gallon pails of paint fell in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration, LLC (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces and swept them in with hand tools. All absorbent waste and product containers were collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon drums and transported to the R+L terminal in Kansas City.

item.title: Report E-2024090259
item.description:

  • City: ELLENWOOD

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 3, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of sulfuric acid was punctured by falling freight and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed neutralizers and granular absorbents to the sulfuric acid-impacted trailer floor and tote exterior. Crews utilized hand tools to collect and containerize all spent absorbents and neutralizers into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. FCE performed a gravity tote transfer of the sulfuric acid into one (1) new 330-gallon tote.

  • Description: On September 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2817 was punctured by a nail and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement below R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the UN2817-impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

  • Description: On 8/31/2024 tank car TILX 135685 was called in with an odor. During the initial assessment, the tank car was found with a manway cover gasket and a nozzle gasket. The cover gasket was deteriorated and cut causing an obstruction and a vapor release. The nozzle gasket showed no signs of issues. The cover gasket was removed as it is not needed when you have a nozzle gasket in place, and because it was damaged. GrayMar Environmental assisted with the response.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE TO RESPOND TO LEAKING PACKAGE IN UNLOAD. RESPONDER BAGAN DMP PROCESS OF LEAKER AND AFFECTED DEBRIS. AFTER CARDBOARD WAS CONTAINERIZED INTO DMP BAG, BAG BEGAN SMOKING AFTER BAG POPPED OPEN. THE SMOKE STOPPED. RESPONDER NOTIFIED RMP. RMP INSTRUCTED CONTENTS TO BE CORDONED OFF OUTSIDE. BAG BEGAN SMOKING A SECOND TIME WHEN OUTSIDE. RMP NOTIFIED SORT MANAGER AND CALLED FOR OUTSIDE RESPONSE TEAM. WHILE BAG WAS OUTSIDE, IT EVENTUALLY CAUGHT FIRE. ALL CONTENTS CONTAINERIZED BY OUTSIDE RESPONSE TEAM AND PLACED IN SHED 2 FOR FWN PROCESSING.

  • Description: On August 30, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3098 arrived with a faulty cap and released approximately less than 0.03 gallons (<0.03) to the top of the tote, which evaporated before crews arrived. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel replaced the faulty cap and staged the tote on site for continued processing and shipping by the facility. A cotton rag was used to remove free standing dirt and debris from the trailer floor and possession of the rag was retained by R+L.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XMI contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 55-gallon DF containing Organic Emitter Clean. A Contractor was dispatched and observed a 0.5-gallon release isolated to the top of the drum as a result of a puncture from a forklift blade. The drum was flipped over in attempt to stop the leak resulting in a product impact to the wooden trailer floor. The Contractor overpacked the damaged and leaking drum into a 95-gallon DF. XPO will manage waste disposal. The impact to the trailer floor evaporated by the time that the contractors attempted to clean it. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.description:
Report E-2024090251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics driver domiciled out of UPH (Pheonix, AZ) contacted ERTS regarding the release of Benco Sanding Sealer. A Contractor was dispatched to the drivers location and observed a 2-gallon release from one 5-gallon PAIL containing Benco Sanding Sealer. The release impacted the wooden trailer floor, the pallet, and the shrink-wrap in a 1x1 area. It was concluded that the release was caused by improper blocking and bracing and therefore load-shift during transit. The Contractor overpacked the leaking container along with the impacted debris and absorbents. The waste was taken to XPO-UPH to manage for end disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024080590
item.description:
Report E-2024080590

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: MULBERRY
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 17, 2024, at 1400 hours, personnel in the CSXT Mulberry Yard discovered tank car TEIX 3132, loaded with Elevated Temperature Liquid, NOS (Asphalt) appeared to have product adhering to side of tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Vertex Energy, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024081700082). Hulls Environmental, a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to inspect the car. Response personnel confirmed asphalt adhering to side and top of tank car, additionally it was noted that product had released due to an improperly secured manway cover. Specifically, 4 of the 8 manway cover swing bolts not applied; 4 of the 8 manway cover swing bolts were less than tool tight; and the manway cover gasket wis aligned. Contractor personnel inspected and reinstalled the gasket, and properly secured the manway cover for transportation. All hazardous product adhering to the exterior of the tank was removed. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative (Scott Ehrlich at 281-799-8576).

item.title: Report E-2024090279
item.description:
Report E-2024090279

  • City: BUTTE
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0938 ET, XPO-UBU notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of UN1993 Latrix 6200 released from 55-gallon poly drum due to a pinhole leak. The release impacted just the pallet. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The damaged drum and cleanup debris were containerized in 65 poly drum which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090290
item.description:

  • City: GLENPOOL

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1455 EST, XPO terminal LTU reported that approximately 2-gallons of UN1263 Diamond Vogal Mult-E-Prime 500 released from (3)1-gallon metal pails due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer # 3212873. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Terminal used oil dri to contain the spill and used a 55-gallon poly drum for the waste. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090271
item.description:
Report E-2024090271

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SET Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the cardboard and packaging and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released. SET Environmental personnel neutralized the impacted area and then cleaned the released material. The damaged pail was overpacked into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum and the recovered material and spent absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

item.title: Report E-2024090269
item.description:

  • City: FREMONT

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Approximately one gallon of 1100SL ACTIVATOR released from one 5-gallon plastic pail impacting the cardboard and packaging. A contractor was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the cardboard and packaging and estimated that one gallon of material was released. The contractor neutralized the impacted area and then cleaned the released material. The damaged pail was overpacked into one 30-gallon poly drum and the recovered material and spent absorbents were placed into one 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. XPO will manage the waste. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Description: At 06:39 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XSW) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to unknown reasons, approximately 3 gallons of G56 Hardener (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The caller advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged can, and oil-dri were placed into a 30 gallon metal overpack drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAB experienced a UN1170 Ethyl Alcohol release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 10' x 15' area of the concrete dock floor. The drum was punctured by a forklift blade. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024090647
item.description:
Report X-2024090647

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: AGUADILLA
  • State: PR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/6/2024 at approximately 1115, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3962724 at the sort facility in Aguadilla, Puerto Rico, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of several packages appearing to be processed through Amazon. Spillage occurred among the packages, prompting FedEx to further investigate, resulting in the identification of the spilled package as nail polish remover, which was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. Dangerous Goods Administration obtained the safety data sheet of a similar product to verify indentification. The other packages remain unopened and the contents unknown. The spilled package was removed from the box and the remainder of the shipment is being held for package retreival.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 4, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was damaged in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the printing ink-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal.

  • Description: During sort operation at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans in plastic bags, positive closure tabs and packing paper for dunnage. Both cans were dented on the top chime causing the lids to open and spill the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024090162
item.description:
Report E-2024090162

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal BCO experienced a UN3266 Chem-Aqua 52885 release from a 20-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Terminal personnel overpacked the damaged drum into a metal overpack prior to contractors arrival. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 5 x 5 area of the concrete dock floor. The drum was punctured during unloading. Contractors containerized the damaged 20-gallon poly drum into a 55-gallon poly overpack. The contaminated metal drum was placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum along with impacted absorbents used to clean the release. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090163
item.description:
Report E-2024090163

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLF experienced a UN1805 Sucrose Emprove Essential Ph Eur,BP,ChP,JP,NF release from (3) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 10' x 28' area of the trailer floor and a 4' x 20' area of the concrete lot below. The pails were crushed by other freight due to improper loading. The contractors deployed absorbents and sodium bicarb to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, the damaged pails, and impacted pallet wood were then collected and containerized into (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024090617
item.description:
Report X-2024090617

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment discovered wet because it was leaked on by another shipmet containg a non hazardous cleaner. Upon opening the brown outer box, it was discovered to contain 2 Black boxes "Marz Distribution, UN1070 Nitrous Oxide 99.0%, UN4GY/15/S/24/CNC297205." Inside of the 2 boxes were 2 smaller boxes that contained 1 cylinder @ 1364 grams. The smaller boxes are marked with the same MFG information , UN#, PSN, Hazard Labels 2.2 NFG and 5.1 Oxidizer. Total of 4 Cylinders-marked with the same mfg and hazard information and the wording "Adult Only 18+, Do Not Inhale, Not For Medical Use, Non refillable, Do Not Inhale, Nitrous Oxide Food and Beverage Additive." There was NO RELEASE. The shipment is being held for FAA investigation.

  • Description: On August 29, 2024, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of ULTRA-CURE SB UV Topcoat Low Gloss were dented due to a faulty skid and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. he customer chose which metal pails he would accept, and FCE personnel removed the rejected metal pails for waste. Eight (8) 5-gallon metal pails were placed into four (4) 55-gallon drums that were labeled as recovered materials, and placed back on the trailer, for return to the Norwalk terminal. The customer said he did not require remediation of the loading dock floor, so crews received his signature that cleanup efforts were complete

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel placed the three (3) damaged 30-gallon drums into three (3) 95-gallon overpack drums that were staged for further handling by R+L terminal personnel. All undamaged freight was restacked for further shipment and processing.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 95-gallon drum. FCE utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. After all freight was neutralized, all impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of Hexahydrohexamethylindenopryan released from one 55-gallon drum due to it rubbing on the strap during transit causing some product to release. The release impacted inside trailer#321-4112. Terminal personnel had already clean the release. The recovered material was placed into a 65-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090042
item.description:
Report E-2024090042

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-11T09:14:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-03
  • City: DALTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HIGHWAY TRANSPORT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Truck left the facility after being loaded. The washout cap was cross threaded and the material splashed out of the washout for approximately 0.9 miles. The truck pulled over and called in to Highway Transport Chemical (HTC). HTC called Environmental Management, Inc. (EMI). EMI called a local environmental emergency response company, Marion Environmental. Marion personnel spread soda ash on the spill and then pressure washed the material. Storm drains were protected by Marion. The wash water was collected with a vacuum truck.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 27, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2810 was damaged by other freight and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. CE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN2810-impacted loading dock floor. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon overpack and all impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums that were staged onsite.

item.title: Report X-2024090439
item.description:
Report X-2024090439

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-11T09:14:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 36000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While working in MR05 track, Harrison Yard, Memphis, TN, a CN Mechanical employee observed a clear liquid leaking from the top of UTLX 125236, (Load, Sulfuric Acid, UN1830,) down the side of the tank car to the ground. CN Mechanical Supervisor notified CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) Vaughan and CN Police. CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) Vaughan performed an inspection of the tank car and found the liquid line cap to be #less than tool tight# and easily manipulated by hand, was actively leaking from the threads onto the tank car and to the ground. Additionally, the air valve plug was found #less than tool tight# and could be manipulated by hand. The air valve was in the fully closed position. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) responded to the site and slowly vented through the air valve to depressurize the tank car. The DGO applied new Teflon tape and tightened the liquid eduction line cap tool tight using a 24# pipe wrench. New Teflon was applied to the air valve plug and properly installed and tightened #tool tight# using a 24# pipe wrench. A CN contractor responded to decontaminate the tank car and the ground. Tank car was secured and set out to the CN Car Shop to await requalification by MRU.

The box contains 12X4oz tubes of BioFreeze Professional Colorless Gel and 2X32oz bottles of Pro Advantage Isopropyl Rubbing Alcohol 70%. The SDS on these two items show that they should be regulated and the inner box that the BioFreeze is in has a limited quantity diamond on it. These items did not leak. A unregulated bottle of ProteX disinfectant has a crack in it and leaked in the box.

item.title: Report E-2024080583
item.description:
Report E-2024080583

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-10T09:23:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Two Veolia employees were unloading a trailer at the Veolia Henderson TSDF, when a pressurized drum was observed. The drum was contained on a pallet on the trailer floor, but appeared to be slightly leaning. An employee attempted to carefully move the drum to a position where it could be managed and depressurized. While re-positioning, the base of the drum split away from the bottom chime, and caused approximately 45 gallons of waste flammable liquids to release onto the trailer floor, secondary containment beneath the trailer, and the receiving dock. The two employees immediately went inside of the office building and contacted Veolia's Emergency Coordinator to report the spill at 22:55 MST. The Emergency Coordinator arrived onsite at 23:30 MST and verified the released material as UN1993 Waste Flammable Liquids at 00:06 MST. A D001 reportable quantity of 100 lbs triggered a report of the incident to the NRC. The NRC report began at 00:17 MST (NRC Report Number 1408646). The spill was also reported to the Colorado Department of Public Health & Environment (CDPHE) using the online environmental spill release report form, submitted at 00:36 MST. Veolia personnel conducted in house cleanup of the released material using absorbent material, and then pressure washed the area. No injuries or exposures occurred.

The customer/shipper was immediately notified of the release and the spill was cleaned up. Once the tanker returned to Veolia, the scrubber was emptied. An internal investigation determined that the most probable cause was that the scrubber was not emptied during the pre-trip inspection.

item.description:
Report E-2024090109

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: SCHENECTADY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During a drum transfer operation between trailers at Veolia's Schenectady, NY 10 day intransit facility, a Veolia employee accidentally punctured a 55-gallon steel drum containing Class 9 hazardous waste liquid. The puncture was caused by an unnoticed metal burr on the drum cart. The release duration was less than one minute resulting in approximately 1 liter of liquid leaked onto the trailer floor. The spill was cleaned using spill pads and absorbent material and the damaged drum was overpacked into an 85-gallon salvage drum for continued transportation to the disposal facility.

item.title: Report E-2024090104
item.description:
Report E-2024090104

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-10T09:23:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL CARRIERS INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Schneider Bulk Carriers notified ERTS of a cargo release in Waterloo, IA. It was reported that 2000 gallons of Performance XXL Alkali needs a transload or an off load from trailer # 28902 due to internal valve leaking. The release impacted asphalt and concrete. Update from the driver advised a small 80-gallon pool with product is filled and a second pool was being used to collect product, but the leak was steady. Clean Harbors arrived on site and advised an estimated 70-gallons were released and caught in the retention pits due to a internal valve leaking. The released product was collected and placed into a 275-gal tote. A vac truck was used to transfer the remainder of product from the tank. The transfer has been completed. The impacted plastics used for retention were cut and drummed. Due to the potential haz waste properties, (1) 275IBC w/ 70-gallons of Performance XXL Alkali; and (1) 55 DF w/ impacted plastic will be left onsite until the profiling was approved for a receiving facility.
